laboratory_examinations.findings: WBC count of 331 cells/mL (76% lymphocytes), protein level of 119 mg/dL, and a normal glucose level.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: On a lumbar puncture 2 weeks later, WBC count decreased to 127 cells/mL (87% lymphocytes), protein level decreased to 92 mg/dL, and glucose level was 36 mg/dL, indicating changes in pleocytosis.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Bifrontal epileptiform discharges and an evolving run of stimulus-induced seizures.
Positive for HHV-6 by PCR (viral load, 30,000 copies/mL).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: On hospital day 40, WBC count decreased to 6 cells/mL and HHV-6 load decreased to 4,400 copies/mL.
Decreased to 17,000 copies/mL 3 months after presentation.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: MRI of the brain and spine
laboratory_examinations.findings: Improvement in the areas of white matter and normal spinal cord.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: CSF HHV-6 IgG and IgM titer testing
laboratory_examinations.findings: CSF HHV-6 IgG titer was 1:1, and IgM titer was undetectable.
